entry.title: The days of the Far East in Moscow

link.title: The days of the Far East in Moscow

entry.content:
Projects

The days of the Far East in Moscow

The results of The Days of the Far East in Moscow Festival, held from 13 to 15 December 2018. We have organized The Festival for the second time, but this year’s different. We have transformed the event from an exhibition into a festival, making it more musical, gastronomic and educational.

25,663

guests
  • Event management
  • Our own event

We have transformed the event from an exhibition into a festival, making it more musical, gastronomic and educational. We have also completely changed the format of the target audience. In that year — schoolchildren, students and young professionals. So we have focused on educational and entertainment portion of the event.

Content

We have really made the most of the scale of the venue — more than 8,000 square meters. We have placed a panoramic cinema about The Russian Far East, a VR-zone, an interactive museum of The Far Eastern capitals, a photo exhibition, a section «Study and work in the far East» and three lecture halls where famous speakers performed.

The educational program was divided into three thematic tracks:

  • The rules of life — motivational workshops from famous and successful people, such as Sergey Minaev (russian writer, journalist, known for his scandalous novels «ДухLess», «Media Sapiens»), Peter Bankov (painter and creative director of DesignDepot) and many others;
  • Anatomy of success — panel discussions on the global transformation of the economy, culture, science, education, political and social processes;
  • Practices that achieve — workshops and master-classes aimed at the development of creative abilities.

4,199

mentions of The Festival in the press

68

speakers

3,550

visitors of the stand The Far Eastern Hectare

2,911

people have undergone career guidance tests

Food and music

It was truly delicious festival. 11 regions of The Russian Far East have brought ingredients and recipes of the brightest dishes of local cuisine. You could try a Burger with venison or crab, Sakhalin trumpeter, wok with scallop and a lot of other things. The chef Dmitry Shurshakov and the Executive Director of «Seven» restaurant Anatoly Petrenko took part in development of the menu and preparation of dishes.

The Russian Far East is not only about authentic food and nature, but also authentic music with its unique style and sound. In each of the three days of The Festival in the music-hall have been performing 8 famous far-eastern bands.

entry.title: Ballet “Crystal Palace”
entry.content:
Projects

Ballet “Crystal Palace”

On September 10, in The Big Hall of the State Kremlin Palace was held the Russian premiere of the ballet with operatic elements — “Crystal Palace”. Invitation campaign and PR-support were executed by Polylog Consulting Group.

Invitation campaign and PR-support were executed by Polylog Consulting Group.

The main task of the Project was to inform Muscovites about the Russian premiere of the ballet.

“Crystal Palace” is a synthetic performance. Opera, ballet and theatrical drama are mixed. Scenery and costumes are constantly changing. The plot of the ballet has a historical background: one day the Empress — actress Ornella Muti — decided to bring about the marriage of a couple of court jesters, but they were to spend the winter night after the nuptials in a specially erected palace right on the River Neva, where the walls, the bed and even the flowers, are made of ice. This is the Crystal Palace.

The initiator and lead organizer of the Project is the European Foundation for Support of Culture (EFSC) headed by Konstantin Ishkhanov. The première of the ballet in Moscow has been organized in collaboration with the Association for Support of Cultural Initiatives (APKI) and the State Kremlin Palace.

  • Public relations
  • Nonprofit Organizations
  • EFSC

Less than a month

One of Polylog’s PR-departments has become the press-office of the ballet: preparation of press-materials, organization of two press-conferences, interaction with foreign and the Russian mass-media, initiation of interviews with the ballet directors and creation of three special projects in the media.

On August 17, was held the first press conference in TASS. Journalists from the main Russian mass-media asked about creative process and preparation. The event was attended by the President of the EFSC Konstantin Ishkhanov, Director Ekaterina Mironova, Director and choreographer Alexander Somov, prima ballerina of the Bolshoi theatre Maria Allash, leading soloist of the Bolshoi theatre Maria Vinogradova, Prime Minister of Mikhailovsky theater Ivan Vasiliev, costume designer Elena Netsvetaeva-Dolgaleva.

418

publications in the media in just one month

95%

of tickets for the premiere sold

A week before

On September 3, in The Big Hall of the State Kremlin Palace was held the dress rehearsal. After that in Metropol Hotel we organized the second press-conference and a presentation of the ballet with participation of Ornella Muti. Moreover, special for journalists there were the music of a famous American and Maltese composer Alexey Shor.

We have been actively working work with the mass-media. There were 15 broadcasts on TV channels: Channel One, Russia 1, Russia Culture, NTV, REN TV, Channel Five, Moscow 24, Vesti.

Working on the promotion of the event, we have tried to put the focus of interest not only on the premiere of the ballet but also on the personalities. Therefore, most of the TV shows are interviews, for example, with Ekaterina Mironova and Alexander Somov.

In addition, we launched three special projects with participation of Alexey Shor: an interview for Tatler, Rossiyskaya Gazeta and Kommersant. Alexey Shor is a mathematician who started writing music six years ago, and today his works are in the repertoire of the world’s leading performers.

And, of course, we placed ads on radio-stations and invited theatrical critics.

Curtains

From August 16 to September 12, 418 messages with the mention of ballet were published. 95% of tickets were sold.

As it happens with any cultural event the opinions of the audience were divided. But for us promotion of the ballet “Crystal Palace” is an invaluable experience of interaction with real artists who in their busy schedule found time for every press-event.

Ornella Muti

entry.title: Moscow City Day 2018: PR support of the event

link.title: Moscow City Day 2018: PR support of the event

entry.content:
Projects

Moscow City Day 2018: PR support of the event

On September 8 and 9, Moscow celebrated its 871st Birthday. PR-support of the event was provided by Polylog.

From year to year Moscow gets prettier, younger and celebrates its birthday more interesting and more colorful. Although it is not the first time we provide PR-support for the event, every time it is a responsible and exciting job.

Corporate identity

Straight to the point. In accordance with the corporate style of the event, we created a 24-second video with General views of the city of Moscow for screens at the main locations. Hundreds of badges were made for the mass media representatives.

For VIP-guests of the event we prepared souvenirs with “I Love Moscow”: sweatshirts, covers for iPhone 8 and iPhone X, canvas bags, umbrellas and raincoats.

Information partnership

The media partners of the event were: Russian international information Agency “RIA Novosti”, “Metro” newspaper, the main TV-channels “Moscow 24”, “TVC”, the largest radio-stations “Europe plus”, “Dorozhnoe radio”, “Radio Dacha”, “Novoe radio”, “Culture”, “Radio 7”, information portals “Izvestia”, “Yandex.Afisha”, “2do2go”, “Vash Dosug”, magazine “7 days”, “Time out”, “KudaGo.com”, “megogo”, the Moscow charity “Moscowcharity”.

The TV-channel “Moscow 24” made on the air 11 stories about Moscow City Day, including several interviews with the Head of the Department of Culture of the Moscow City Government Alexander Kibovsky.

30 announcements went on the air of radio “Culture”, 48 — on “Radio 7”, 70 — on “Europe Plus” and 130 — on “Novoe radio”. Other information partners placed banners and program of the event on their websites.

Working with the mass media

As a part of the celebration, we organized 3 press-scrums to Kibovsky Alexander. The first one took place on 29 August in the Concert hall “Zaryadye”, the second — on 8 September in the media-center of Zaryadye Park, and the last one — on 9 September in the garden “Hermitage”.

In Zaryadye Park was organized a mobile press-center. More than 100 journalists attended it. Overall, we accredited 863 journalists.

From 4 to 12 September, the total number of publications — 625, including 42 TV-stories, 27 printed publications, 556 online-publications.

Content

We prepared and posted information about the events of 19 venues on the website mos.ru. In parallel we carried out their promotion through social networks of the Department of Culture of the Moscow City Government. We organized photo and video shooting in the epicenters of the event.

After celebration we created the reporting video, using the frames of the corporate identity.

View video summary (in Russian)

10M

people attended the Moscow City Day

625

publications for the holiday week only

Subtotal

About 10 million people attended the Moscow City Day. This holiday was distinguished by the Grand opening of the concert hall “Zaryadye”. The ceremony was attended by Vladimir Putin and Sergei Sobyanin, Moscow Mayor. At the end of 8 September, the sky was painted with dozens of fireworks from 30 points across the capital.

The event really grandiose and bright! Polylog-team would like to thank the Department of Culture of the Moscow City Government for their trust in PR-support of the event.

entry.title: The Contest “Polyus. The Golden Season”: the third chapter

link.title: The Contest “Polyus. The Golden Season”: the third chapter

entry.content:
Projects

The Contest “Polyus. The Golden Season”: the third chapter

For the third time Polylog Consulting Group has conducted organization and PR-support of the socio-cultural project of gold mining company “Polyus” — The Contest “Polyus. The Golden Season”.

For the third time Polylog Consulting Group has conducted organization and PR-support of the socio-cultural project of gold mining company “Polyus” — The Contest “Polyus. The Golden Season”.

“Polyus” is the largest gold producer in Russia and one of the Top-10 gold producer globally with one of the lowest cost profiles. Its principal operations are located in Krasnoyarsk, Irkutsk and Magadan regions and the Sakha Republic (Yakutia). It includes 5 operating mines, alluvial operations and several advanced development projects.

Objectives

  • Positioning of “Polyus” in the eyes of the regional authorities and the public as a large and reliable company that supports not only financial stability in the regions of presence, but also their socio-cultural development;
  • Building and development of loyal relations with the regional target audience;
  • Formation of a socially responsible image of the company at the federal level.

Start

We began in March with the approval of the competition format, updating the criteria for the selection of theater groups and determining the main prize.

To become a participant of the Contest, it was necessary to send an application with a description of the social mission of theater and a video of a dramatic performance for an adult audience until May 1, 2018. A professional evaluation of the received applications was carried out by the expert council, included leading theatrical figures.

At the same time, we provided PR-support of the Contest. We created newsworthy stories and wrote press-releases, as well as prepared content for social networks — Facebook and Vkontakte. In addition, we attracted information partners from the Federal and regional media.

Deadline has come

This year, 32 theaters from the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia), Krasnoyarsk territory, Irkutsk and Magadan regions participated in the Contest. It is twice more than in 2017. On June 14, at a press conference in Krasnoyarsk, the winners — 8 best teams — were announced.

The winners received an opportunity to present their performances at the festival of modern art “Territory. Krasnoyarsk”, held from 10 to 16 September in Krasnoyarsk.

Days of the festival

8 finalist-theaters took part in the educational, cultural and exhibition programs of the festival “Territory. Krasnoyarsk”. Famous directors, actors, choreographers, producers, theater critics and art-managers conducted several master-classes and lectures for the winners.

Leading Moscow theaters and associations — The Theater of Nations, The Center of Meyerhold, the Theatre “Ballet Moscow”, the Workshop of Dmitry Brusnikin, “Theater of reciprocal action” —showed their plays.

428

publications in federal and regional media

32

Russian
theaters

“The arrival of the festival “Territory. Krasnoyarsk is very important for us. We will see plays, showing in Moscow and European capitals. Thanks to ‘Polyus’ and the festival”

Elena Mironenko, acting Minister of culture of the region.

La commedia e finita

In the Federal and regional media were published 428 materials about the Contest “Polyus. The Golden Season” and the festival “Territory. Krasnoyarsk”. Comparing with 2017, the number of publications increased by 89%. 7 regional media became the information partners of the Contest.

From March to October 2018 the Contest have been covering in detail in social networks — Facebook, Vkontakte. In the accounts of the Contest were published 80 messages.

entry.title: Qatar 2022: launch of the public relations campaign

entry.content:
Projects

Qatar 2022: launch of the public relations campaign

In 2022 Qatar will host 2022 FIFA World Cup™. The main task of the project was to make pleasant and unforgettable acquaintance of fans with the country during The World Cup in Russia. The organizer of interactive objects for Muscovites and guests of the capital was the Ceremonies Staging Agency. Complex information support of the project was performed by Polylog Consulting Group.

In 2022 Qatar will host 2022 FIFA World Cup™. The main task of the project was to make pleasant and unforgettable acquaintance of fans with the country during The World Cup in Russia. The organizer of interactive objects for Muscovites and guests of the capital was the Ceremonies Staging Agency. Complex information support of the project was performed by Polylog Consulting Group.

Bloggers and journalists

For the first time The World Cup will be held in Qatar, for the first time — in the middle East, for the first time — in winter. We were convinced of the absolute validity of the decision in May when we have been conducting a blog tour and a press tour to the capital of Qatar, Doha. The program of the tours included: visiting The World Cup stadiums, cultural and infrastructure facilities. It was so hot that most of the streets were deserted before sunset. After the snowy Moscow spring, it was literally a test for us.

The blog tour have been conducted from 10 to 13 May along with pranker Vitaly Zdorovetchi, extreme-rufer Rascalov Vitaly and Sergey Alexeev, the author of the blog “Real football”.

The press tour have been held from 11 to 14 May. 19 journalists from 17 publishing houses arrived in Qatar: Match TV, Russia Today, Championat.com, Sports.ru, TASS, RIA Novosti, Rossiyskaya Gazeta, Interfax and others.

Back to Moscow

Working on the project, it was important for us not only to talk about where and how the next championship will be held, but also to overcome the stereotype of Qatar as a closed state. We have been striving to bring the message that Qatar is safe, modern and progressive country with a huge tourism and investment potential.

The Ceremonies Staging Agency developed offline activities to show Qatar for Muscovites and guests of the capital, thanks to which everyone felt themselves as a part of the upcoming grand event. The CSA have created:

Qatar-Russia Portals

Placed in iconic locations in Moscow, St Petersburg and Doha, the interactive portals connected fans from around the world and gave them a preview of the plans for 2022. The Portals destroyed the language barrier between fans from the whole world.

Qatar @roadto2022 Exhibition

The collection of rare FIFA World Cup™ memorabilia at GUM in Red Square, which also included models of the stadiums being constructed for The 2022 Tournament. At the end of the journey through the past, present and future of The World Cup, visitors recorded their messages to qatari people, thereby playing a role in the history of football.

Majlis Qatar

Located in Moscow’s Gorky Park, Majlis Qatar introduced Qatar and the 2022 FIFA World Cup™. Fans became immersed in qatari culture while enjoying live matches and learning more about the opportunities available in Qatar. Also there have been sculptures in the form of Arab Oryx — the national animal of Qatar. The sculptures were created specifically for the exhibition by famous artists of Russia and Qatar.

Qatar Elements

It is the world’s first temporary digital museum on the water. This unique LED light show on the Moskva river served as a beacon to visitors near and far. It brought Qatar’s natural and manmade wonders to life for thousands of fans.

Results

At the beginning of 2019, 48 metro stations will be opened in Doha and an updated system of public and water transport will be launched. They will connect five stadiums of The World Championship. But for us the Arabic tale has come to an end and it is time to take stock.

From 6 to 15 July more than 750 000 people visited “Qatar @roadto2022 Exhibition” at GUM. There were 11 TV stories, 4 printed materials, 273 publications in online editions.

people visited the exhibition

Instagram Stories views

The blog tour: Sergey Alekseev’s video has collected more than 100 000 views within a week. Vitaly Zdorovetchi’s video — more than 700 000. Instagram Stories, posted by journalists and bloggers, gained more than 1.5 million views.

  • The opening ceremony of Majlis Qatar was attended by 2 686 people, including about 130 representatives of the Russian and foreign media, including all major news agencies: TASS, RIA Novosti, Interfax; as well as the Russian TV-channels: Channel One, Russia, Russia 1, Match TV, NTV, Culture, Channel 5, Moscow 24, RBC and others.
  • In total, from 7 to 15 July, Majlis Qatar was visited by 48 268 people.
  • During the same period of time, the Museum “Qatar Elements” was visited by 13 101 people.
  • More than 2.5 million people interacted with The Portals in three cities.
  • In social media there were more than 3 116 mentions of Majlis Qatar, 431 — of The Portals, 97 messages about “Qatar @roadto2022 Exhibition”.
  • In total by July 17, there were 12 television news, 4 printed articles and 218 online publications about Qatari activities in Russia. In addition, 3116, 431 and 97 messages about Majlis Qatar, The Portals and “Qatar @roadto2022” Exhibition respectively appeared in social media.
  • The opening ceremonies of the objects were attended by celebrities and bloggers: Victoria Lopyreva, Vladimir stognienko, George Cherdantsev, Vasily Utkin, Ilya Varlamov, Dmitry Egorov, Andrey Bartenev.
  • We carried out advertising campaign in Moscow (Sheremetyevo, Domodedovo, Vnukovo) and St. Petersburg (Pulkovo) airports. Videos, telling about The Championship, have been broadcasting in the main halls, waiting rooms and baggage claim areas.
  • In the most popular places, from June 15 to July 15, were held an outdoor advertising campaign:
    • 9 Moscow buses have been branded with the 2022 FIFA World Cup™ identity;
    • Multimedia advertising have been broadcasted at 18 points of the capital’s metro stations;
    • Digital billboards have been located in 21 points of Moscow.
  • Advertising have been placed in the most popular Internet websites and media: RBC, Afisha, Kommersant, Forbes, Vedomosti, Championat.com, Sports.ru, MATCH!, AdFox.
  • A survey among visitors showed:
    • 99% of respondents are satisfied with the quality of the offline activations;
    • 92% are satisfied with the location of Majlis Qatar;
    • 95% told that they received high quality information;
    • 99% will recommend to friends and acquaintances visiting Majlis Qatar.
  • The events were highly appreciated by the Federal and city authorities, as well as by the media.

entry.title: Toy car races along world’s longest Hot Wheels track

link.title: Toy car races along world’s longest Hot Wheels track

entry.content:
Projects

Toy car races along world’s longest Hot Wheels track

Hot Wheels has been a staple of childhoods ever since its first toy car sped into children’s lives 50 years ago. On August 25, the Russian Hot Wheels office set a new Guinness world record in Moscow’s Zaryadye Park. The idea, organization and information support of the event — Polylog Consulting Group.

Hot Wheels has been a staple of childhoods ever since its first toy car sped into children’s lives 50 years ago. On August 25, the Russian Hot Wheels office set a new Guinness world record in Moscow’s Zaryadye Park. The idea, organization and information support of the event — Polylog Consulting Group.

Prologue

For 6 years Polylog Consulting Group have been cooperating with Mattel Russia, which includes Hot Wheels. On the eve of the anniversary of Hot Wheels, we started thinking: “How to make the day of the brand Foundation absolutely unforgettable?”. The answer has come at once — we need to take a chance, put everything on the line and declare that we will break the world record: our machine will come a record distance on the longest toy track. The previous record was registered two years ago in Arizona: the car crossed 554 meters track. We have said that we will overcome 560 meters.

To count as a valid attempt at least one car had to complete the track without flipping off or completely stopping and, despite some close calls, one managed to successfully complete its journey without leaving the track or receiving putside help.

Culmination

August 25 has become for us almost the final of The World Cup. The track stretched a huge 560.30 m (1,838 ft 3.05 in) in length — making it longer than the height of New York’s Empire State Building! Start is given. The machine has passed the first turn, the second, the last one and have finished in 3 minutes and 15 seconds. Record has set. And then like in the best traditions of the finals of Formula 1- champagne flowed like a river.

Today is a significant day for Mattel Inc. Russia’s Hot Wheels brand team. We have set the new world record and got into the Guinness book of records. Today’s event will certainly go down in history, and we are very pleased that each of you have been involved in this success,- said Mattel CEO in Russia Alexey Dmitriev.

Final

On the day families gathered to watch the toy car speed around the Moscow park, as well as local TV channels which came to cover the event.

The track consisted of 1,112 regular straight track pieces, 50 boosters and four sharp, nail-biting turns with more than 100 people helping to build it between midnight and 9am.

Before the attempt took place, the track was measured by a qualified surveyor in the presence of adjudicator Seyda Subasi Gemici. Afterwards, adjudicator Seyda awarded Mattel Inc. its official Guinness World Records title certificate at the finish line.

More than 50 media representatives and about 90 thousand guests witnessed the record. Children were given more than 8 thousand collection cars, released specifically for the anniversary of Hot Wheels.

Polylog-team is very grateful to Mattel for have been trusting in us for 6 years in a row and giving us the opportunity to be involved in such grandiose and interesting projects.

entry.title: The Day of the Industrialist of Moscow Region

link.title: The Day of the Industrialist of Moscow Region

entry.content:
Projects

The Day of the Industrialist of Moscow Region

On July 5, The Day of the Industrialist of Moscow Region was held in The House of Moscow Region Government. Polylog Consulting Group engaged comprehensive preparation and conducting of the event.

On July 5, The Day of the Industrialist of Moscow Region was held in The House of Moscow Region Government. Polylog Consulting Group engaged comprehensive preparation and conducting of the event.

The Day of the Industrialist of Moscow Region is a discussion platform for industry representatives, where they can meet and find new partners and innovative solutions.

The Agency’s Tasks

  1. Develop the format of the event;
  2. Make the event informative and productive;
  3. Develop a business program and scenario for the plenary session;
  4. Conduct an invitation campaign of participants and speakers;
  5. Develop a visual design of the forum;
  6. Accredit participants and the mass media representatives;
  7. Prepare and hold the ceremony of awarding the best enterprises and specialists of Moscow Region.

Beginning

We have been striving to move away from the usual format of the plenary session and add a live communication between representatives of the state and business. Therefore, we proposed to hold the main event of the Forum in a debate format, dividing the speakers into teams “for” and “against”.

Having studied the main topics of the event, we proposed two questions for discussion at the plenary session:

  1. Is Moscow Region able to produce an export product?
  2. Is Moscow Region ready to provide industrial enterprises with personnel?

The Forum

The Day of the Industrialist of Moscow Region was opened by Denis Butsaev — Deputy Prime Minister of Moscow Region, Minister of investments and innovations of Moscow Region. He welcomed the audience and presented awards, including the Governor’s gratitude, to eleven teams of Moscow Region’s enterprises.

The Plenary session was moderated by Kirill Tokarev, editor-in-chief and journalist of RBC. After voting and discussing the issues of export and personnel, we received truthful, but critical, answers. For example, answering the question “Is Moscow Region ready to provide industrial enterprises with personnel?” 73% of respondents gave a negative answer.

In the second part of the Forum, participants were invited to attend round-table talks and master-classes on the exchange of experience in the application of regional measures to support investment and innovation activities, the creation of innovative scientific and technical centers and state support for export-oriented enterprises.

The results

More than 400 people attended the event — top officials of the largest industrial enterprises of Moscow Region, representatives of Universities and Colleges, investors, heads of the region, representatives of the expert and scientific community.

From June 1 to July 9, 194 publications were published, including 24 — in the Federal media, 170 — in the regional media.

publications were published

entry.title: Scania. Next generation. Test drive
entry.content:
Projects

Scania. Next generation. Test drive

On June 1, in NAMI’s Testing Centre took place a great test drive of Scania’s new truck range. Polylog Consulting Group provided PR-support for the long-awaited and significant event for Scania Russia.

What happened?

Scania is introducing a new truck range, the result of ten years of development work. With the new range, Scania is extending its offering and can now, thanks to its unique modular system, supply more performance stages, connectivity and a comprehensive palette of productivity-enhancing services as well as sustainable transportation solutions that are precisely customised for each type of customer in the highly comp­etitive transportation industry. Scania’s customers will always be able to carry out their work in the most sustainable and profitable way, regardless of industry and area of application.

What else?

Among the chance to drive such a huge car, there were a lot of things to do for journalists during the test drive. For example, it was possible to make a photo of machines not only in a static position, but also in motion like shooting the chase.

Different routes were provided for different types of cars, so that journalists could evaluate the work of 15 new models in a variety of conditions.

Finally

The press conference with the General Director of Scania-Rus Wojciech Rovinski and the presentation of equipment, held by product-manager Scania-Rus Pavel Solomatin, have been held for 25 representatives of the Russian media and bloggers.

Journalists and bloggers had a talk not only with representatives of Scania-Rus, but also with partners of the company — a tire manufacturer MICHELIN, body builders Wielton and Jyfa CIS and Palfinger, a manufacturer of cranes for the logging industry.

On the day of the test drive for the first time in Russia was presented the entire range of Scania’s new truck range, as well as integrated solutions — financing and insurance, FMS and driver training, service contracts and flexible maintenance plan Scania Flex, original spare parts, Scania oil and program “Scania Drive”.

entry.content:
Projects

The new automated system for the Federal Agency for Tourism

In December 2017, the Research and Development Department of the Polylog Consulting Group successfully completed project on automating the processes of issuing permits by the Federal Agency for Tourism to carry out activities in the field of tourism related to the use of foreign tourist vessels (further — Permits).

In December 2017, the Research and Development Department of the Polylog Consulting Group successfully completed project on automating the processes of issuing permits by the Federal Agency for Tourism to carry out activities in the field of tourism related to the use of foreign tourist vessels (further — Permits).

In accordance with the Decree of the Government of the Russian Federation No. 679 of June 03, 2017, the Federal Agency for Tourism is determined by the authorized body to issue Permits.

The purpose of the project was to automate the entire cycle of processing applications for the provision of public services. According to the results of the first stage of the project (survey and projecting), a package of technical documentation was formed, including a draft passport of public services, recommendations for optimizing the processes of providing public services, as well as a draft of technical specification for the placement of services on Public Services Portal of the Russian Federation

At the second stage, the development of an Automated information system “issuance of permits for activities in the field of tourism related to the use of foreign tourist vessels” was carried out directly. The system provides a complete cycle of processing of applications by the Federal Agency for Tourism: from the moment of receipt of an application for the provision of public services to the issuance of a Permit to the applicant.

entry.title: Victory Day 2018
entry.content:
Projects

Victory Day 2018

On 8 and 9 May 2018, Moscow, as well as many other cities, hold celebrations to honor the 73nd anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany in the Great Patriotic War of 1941-1945. In two days more than 300 events were held at 33 city venues, which were supported by the Department of Culture of the Moscow City Government. For the third time, Polylog Consulting Group provided PR-support of the events.

Base, mailing, accreditation

Having updated the media database of the previous year and having sent out the announcement of the events, we accredited more than 1,000 media representatives. This figure is twice as high as the previous year. Reporters and cameramen of the most popular Russian tv-channels — Channel One, Russia 1, TVC, Mir, BBC, Moscow-24 — attended various Moscow’s venues.

9 information partners were involved: Russian News Agency TASS, radio stations “Culture” and “Avtoradio”, newspapers Izvestia and Komsomolskaya Pravda, TV-Channels “Moscow 24” and “Zvezda”, Russian Agency of International Information “RIA Novosti” and Yandex.Afisha.

Announcement

We have developed a visual design of advertising campaign in accordance with the updated corporate identity: avatars, covers for social networks, posters, videoclips. The last ones were broadcasting on 8 and 9 May on the grounds of the celebration: the Cathedral of Christ the Savior, Poklonnaya hill, squares of railway stations, Tsaritsyno and Izmailovsky parks.

Short announcements have been developed for radio stations “Culture”, “Autoradio”, “Humor FM”, “Romance”, “LikeFM”, “NRG”.

visitors

1000

journalists

374

publications

SMM

We posted news and announcements on five online platforms of the Department of culture of Moscow: Vkontakte, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Telegram. From 4 to 10 May, the total audience coverage was 73 087 contacts, and the number of “likes”, reposts and comments — 6 119.

For example, more than 2 million Muscovites and guests of the capital took part in the celebration of Victory Day on Poklonnaya hill.

Bright finish

Festive fireworks “painted” Moscow’s sky in hundreds of different shades thundering thousands of volleys. 3 064 artists performed at the venues of the celebration. And more than 7.5 million people became spectators and participants of one of the main events of the country.
